text: a good piece of meat doesn't need
anything except for salt and pepper
but I thought blue cheese a little
butter a little hot sauce with my steak
we just give it an extra and you know
what it was really good a really good
bone-in ribeye is gonna have marbling
it's gonna have veins of fat that will
render while you cook it and it gives
the meat an incredible flavor first rule
for grilling pretty much anything is you
want to season it ahead and this also
gives the steak a chance to come up to
room temperature if it's been in your
fridge and now what you want to do is
just let this hang out let it absorb the
salt and you have time to prepare the
grill when I grill we use charcoal
because that's what we've got and
whenever you're grilling over charcoal
the way that you regulate the heat is
the cover so you can cover the grill and
then that slows down the fire or you can
take the cover off and then it can be a
little bit hotter so while that's
cooking I'm just gonna make some cheese
crumbles I've got a really beautiful
blue cheese and then what I'm gonna do
is I'm gonna put it on top of the steak
and let it get a little melting first
I'm gonna flip them
so once you get a nice sear on both
sides of the meat you just want to move
it over to the unlit side of the grill
and now I'm gonna add the bleu cheese
right on top
I wanted the bleu cheese to get a little
bit melted so I added it right at the
end of cooking I just crumbled it on top
of the steak and then I let the residual
heat of the meat cook the bleu cheese
you want it to be 125 for medium-rare
then you take it off the grill let it
sit for a few minutes and the
temperature rises to 130 I could have
left the steak with the bleu cheese by
itself that would have been great but
just to have even more flavor
I took melted butter mixed it with a
touch of hot sauce and some chives and
to me the whole thing was sort of
reminiscent of buffalo chicken wings
except with steak
Oh
